quiz.text: Abhishek purchased 140 shirts and 250 trousers @ Rs. 450 and @ Rs. 550 respectively. What should be the overall average selling price of shirts and trousers so that 40% profit is earned? (rounded off to next integer)
options: Rs. 725
Rs. 710
Rs. 720
Rs. 700
None of these

quiz.text: A trader marks his goods 40% above the cost price and allows a discount of 25%. The profit he makes, is
options: 15%
10%
5%
2%
None of these

quiz.text: A man sold his two cars for Rs. 4.5 lakh each. In the sale of first car, he incurred 20% profit and in the sale of the second, he incurred 20% loss. The total amount of profit or loss is?
options: profit of Rs. 20250
loss of Rs. 20250
profit of Rs. 37500
loss of Rs. 37500
None of these

quiz.text: By selling an article at 80% of its marked price, a shopkeeper makes a loss of 10%. What will be the profit percentage if he sells it at 95% of its marked price?
options: 6.9%
5%
5.9%
12.5%
None of these

quiz.text: A trader purchase a wrist watch and a pendulum for Rs.390. He sells them making a profit of 10% on the watch and 15% on the pendulum. He earns a profit of Rs. 51.50. The difference between the original prices of the pendulum and the watch is equal to?
options: Rs. 80
Rs. 120
Rs. 110
Rs. 100
None of these

quiz.text: A tradesman gives 4% discount on the marked price and gives 1 book free for buying every 15 books and thus gains 35%. The marked price is increased above the cost price by (approx.) what percentage?
options: 50%
35%
40%
20%
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper purchased 150 identical pieces of furniture at the rate of Rs. 250 each. He spent an amount of Rs. 2500 on packing. He fixed the price of each each furniture at Rs. 320. However, he decided to give a discount of 5% on the labeled price. What is the percent profit earned by him?
options: 16%
15%
14%
20%
None of these

quiz.text: An Ox and a carriage together cost Rs. 8000. The ox is sold at profit of 10% and carriage is sold at loss of 10%. If total profit made is 2.5%, then what is the cost price of the ox?
options: Rs. 3000
Rs. 3500
Rs. 4000
Rs. 5000
None of these

quiz.text: With a 5% discount on the cost of sugar, a buyer could purchase 2 kg more sugar for Rs. 608. What is the initial Selling price of sugar?
options: Rs. 15.50
Rs. 15
Rs. 16.50
Rs. 16
None of these

quiz.text: A trader marked his goods at 20% above the cost price. He sold half the stock at the marked price, one quarter at a discount of 20% on the marked price and the rest at a discount of 40% on the marked price. His total gain is?
options: 2%
4.5%
13.5%
15%
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper marks his goods at 25% above his cost price and allows customers a discount of 12.5% for cash. Find his percentage profit?
options: 12.8%
None of these

quiz.text: A trader put the price of his goods 25% above cost price but allows 12.5% discount for cash payment. If he sells the goods for Rs. 875, find the cost price of the goods?
options: Rs. 800
Rs. 875
Rs. 925
Rs. 975
None of these

quiz.text: Harkesh bought a certain quantity of tomato at the rate of Rs. 1500 per quintal. 10% of the tomato was spoiled. At what price should he sell the remaining to gain 20% of his outlay?
options: Rs. 1800 per quintal
Rs. 2000 per quintal
Rs. 2200 per quintal
Rs. 2400 per quintal
None of these

quiz.text: Aman buys 5 laptops and 7 computers for Rs. 58500. He sells the laptops at a profit of 10% and computers at a profit of 16% and his whole gain is Rs. 7110. What price does he pay for a laptop?
options: Rs. 7500
Rs. 8200
Rs. 9100
Rs. 10500
None of these

quiz.text: A reduction of 10% in the price of rice enables to obtain 25 kg more for Rs. 2250. Find the reduced price per kg of the rice.
options: Rs. 8.50
Rs. 9
Rs. 10.50
Rs. 11
None of these

quiz.text: Sanjay purchased a chair marked at Rs. 800 at 2 successive discount of 10% and 15% respectively. He spent Rs. 28 on transportation and sold the chair for Rs. 800. How much is his gain percentage?
options: 14%
30%
25%
40%
None of these

quiz.text: When a book is sold at its Market Price it gives a profit of 40%. What will happen if it is sold at half the market Price?
options: 30% profit
25% loss
30% loss
40% profit
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya purchased 14 shirt & 25 pants at Rs. 45 and Rs. 55 respectively. What should be the approximate overall average selling price of shirt and pant that 40% profit is earned?
options: Rs. 72.5
Rs. 71
Rs. 72
Rs. 70
None of these

quiz.text: A person sells 36 apple per rupee and suffers a loss of 4%. Find how many apple per rupees to be sold to have a gain of 8%.
options: 32
16
4
15
None of these

quiz.text: Ram sells an article to Girish at a gain 20%, Girish sells it to Sanjay at a gain of 10% and Sanjay sells it to Aditya at a gain of 12.5% . If Aditya pay Rs. 59.40. What did it cost Ram?
options: Rs. 40
Rs. 22
Rs. 24
Rs. 18
None of these

quiz.text: A fruit seller sells 3/5th part of fruit at a profit of 10% and remaining at a loss of 5%. If the total profit is Rs. 1500 then what is the total cost price of fruit?
options: Rs. 37500
Rs. 37000
Rs. 36500
Rs. 36000
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper buys a toy at Rs. 100 and sells it at Rs. 125. Another shopkeeper buys the same toy at Rs. 125 but sells it at Rs. 100. What are the respective profit and loss percentages for the two shopkeepers.
options: 20%, 20%
25%, 20%
25%, 25%
25%,
None of these

quiz.text: The marked price of a bed is Rs. 2400. The shopkeeper gives successive discounts of 10% and X% to customer. If the customer pays Rs. 1836 for the bed then find the value of X?
options: 15%
18%
12%
10%
None of these

quiz.text: Three successive discounts of 10%, 12% and 15% will amount to a single discount of?
options: 36.28%
32.68%
34.68%
37%
None of these

quiz.text: A loss of 19% gets converted into profit of 17% when the selling price is increased by Rs. 162. Find the cost price of the article.
options: Rs. 300
Rs. 350
Rs. 400
Rs. 450
None of these

quiz.text: Sarita sells a Phone at a profit of 20%. If she had bought it at 20% less and sold it for Rs. 180 less, she would have gained 25%. Find the cost price of the Phone.
options: Rs. 800
Rs. 850
Rs. 900
Rs. 1000
None of these

quiz.text: Ravi purchases 90 pens and sells 40 pens at a gain of 10% and 50 pens at a gain of 20%. Had he sold all of them at a uniform profit of 15% he would have got Rs. 40 less. Find the cost price of each pen.
options: Rs. 80
Rs. 75
Rs. 90
Rs. 100
None of these

quiz.text: Savita buys 5 shirts and 10 pants for Rs. 1600. She sells shirts at a profit of 15% and pants at a loss of 10%. If her over all profit was Rs. 90, what was the cost price of a shirt and a pant?
options: Rs. 175, Rs. 50
Rs. 200, Rs. 50
Rs. 200, Rs. 60
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: At a cost of 60 paise per article, Sarika produces 750 articles. She puts the selling price such that if only 600 articles are sold, she would have made a profit of 40% on the outlay. However, 120 articles got spoilt and she was able to sell 630 articles at this price. Find her actual profit or loss percent as the percentage of total outlay assuming that the unsold articles are useless.
options: 47% profit
51% profit
36% loss
28% loss
None of these

quiz.text: Kritika bought 25 i-pads and i-phones for Rs. 205000. She sold 80% of the i-pads and 12 i-phones for a profit of Rs. 40000. Each i-pad was marked up by 20% over cost and each i-phone was sold at a profit of Rs. 2000. The remaining i-pads and 3 i-phones could not be sold. What is Kritika's overall profit/loss?
options: Rs. 500 profit
Rs. 1000 loss
Rs. 1500 profit
no profit, no loss
None of these

quiz.text: Sasha goes to a shop to buy a sofa set and a center table. She bargains for a 10% discount on the center table and and 25% discount on sofa set. However, the manager, by mistake, interchanged the discount percentage figures while making the bill and Sasha paid accordingly. When compared to what she should pay for her purchases, what percentage did Sasha pay extra given that the center table costs 40% as much as the sofa set.
options: 7.1%
7.5%
7.9%
8.1%
None of these

quiz.text: Paras Health Care made 3000 strips of vitamin tablets at a cost of Rs. 4800. The company gave away 1000 strips of tablets to doctors as free samples. A discount of 25% is given on the printed price. Find the ratio of profit if the price is raised from Rs. 3.25 to Rs. 4.25 per strip and if at the latter price, samples to doctors were done away with.
options: 36 : 7
49 : 3
63.5 : 1
71 : 7
None of these

quiz.text: APD printed 3000 copies of 'Career Power' at a cost of Rs. 240000. It gave 500 copies free to different philanthropic institutions. It allowed a discount of 25% on the published price and gave one copy free for every 25 copies bought at a time. It was able to sell all the copies in this manner. If the published price is Rs. 325, then what is its overall gain or loss percentage in the whole transaction?
options: 89% gain
120% loss
140% loss
143.75% gain
None of these

quiz.text: Surbhi bought a combined total of 25 i-pads and i-phones. She marked up the i-pad by 20% on the cost price, while each i-phone was sold at a profit of Rs. 2000. She was able to sell 75% of the i-pads and 2 i-phones and make a profit of Rs. 49000. The remaining i-pads and 3 i-phones could not be sold by her. Find her overall profit or loss if she gets no return on unsold items and it is known that an i-phone costs 50% of an i-pad.
options: Loss of Rs. 48500
Gain of Rs. 48500
Gain of Rs. 51400
No profit, No loss
None of these

quiz.text: A merchant buys 4000 kg of wheat, one-fifth of which he sells at a gain of 5 per cent, one-fourth at a gain of 10%, one-half at a gain of12 percent, and the remainder at a gain of 16 percent. If he had sold the whole at a gain of 11 percent, he would have made Rs. 72.80 more. What was the cost price of the crop per kg?
options: Rs. 2
Rs. 2.60
Rs. 2.50
Rs. 2.80
None of these

quiz.text: If the percentage of profit on selling product A is 15%, then what is its cost of packaging?
options: Rs. 82.43
Rs. 83.50
Rs. 86.56
Rs. 71.09
Rs. 77.80

quiz.text: What is the difference between the selling price of products B and C, if the cost of transportation of C is Rs. 8?
options: Rs. 26.6
Rs. 32.4
Rs. 29.8
Rs. 36.4

quiz.text: Suppose all the prices are given for per kg of a product. What amount of product B will have to be added to 33 kg of product E such that the resultant product costs Rs. 86?
options: 64.1 kg
51.9 kg
62.7 kg
54.3 kg
50.7 kg

quiz.text: What is the percentage profit (approximate) on selling product D if its selling price is 80% of the selling price of B?
options: 28%
30%
40%
35%

quiz.text: If 2 kg of A, 3 kg of C and 4 kg of E are sold, then what will be the final profit/loss% (approximate) on selling these given transportation cost of C as Rs. 5 and profit of 5% on selling A?
options: 22%
8%
17%
14%
12%

quiz.text: Rahul purchased a mobile and sold it for a loss (loss % given in the table). From that money, he purchased another article and sold it for a gain of (Profit % given in the table). What is the overall gain or loss?
options: Proft of Rs. 21
Profit of Rs. 24
Loss of Rs. 21
Loss of Rs. 24
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C invests rupees 8000, 12000 and 10000 respectively in a business. At the end of year the balance sheet shows a loss of initital investment. Find the share of loss of B.
options: 4000
4500
4800
5000
None of these

quiz.text: A shop keeper sells two bags for Rs. 500 each. On one, he gets % profit (as per the table) and on the other he gets % loss (as per the table). His profit or loss in the entire transaction was?
options: 64/25% Gain
49/25% Gain
64/25% Loss
49/25% Loss
None of these

quiz.text: The price of the TV was marked up by % (as per table), it was sold at a discount of 20% on the Marked price. What was the profit percent of the cost price?
options: 10%
11%
15%
12%
None of these

quiz.text: Preethi sold a machine to Shalini at a profit of %(as per table). Shalini sold this machine to Arun at a loss of %(as per table). If Preethi paid Rs. 5000 for this machine, then find the cost price of machine for Arun?
options: 6200
5200
4800
4750
None of these

quiz.text:
Rajnish buys 30 books and 65 pens. If price of each book is more than price of each pen then what money does he have to pay for this?

Statement A. At a profit of 20% he sells all the objects for Rs 3828.

Statement B. The CP of one book and one pen is Rs 90.

Statement C. The difference of sum and difference of buying price of one pen and one book is Rs 28.
options: Only A alone is sufficient
B and C together are sufficient
A alone or B and C together are sufficient
All together are necessary
All even together are not sufficient

quiz.text:
What is the cost price of the book?

Statement A. After allowing a discount of 18% on printed price shopkeeper charges Rs 516.60 for it.

Statement B. If he had not allowed any discount, he would have a profit of 25%.

Statement C. If he had allowed only 10% discount on printed price then he would have 12.5% profit.
options: Any two of them
A with either B or C
Any one of them
All together is required
A and either B or C

quiz.text:
What is the cost price of the book?

Statement A. After allowing a discount of 18% on printed price shopkeeper charges Rs 516.60 for it.

Statement B. If he had not allowed any discount, he would have a profit of 25%.

Statement C. If he had allowed only 10% discount on printed price then he would have 12.5% profit.
options: Any two of them
A and Either B or C
Any one of them
All together is required
A and either B or C

quiz.text:
A shopkeeper sells articles at a certain profit. Find out the amount of profit.

Statement A. Ratio of the selling price to the cost price of the articles is 5 : 4.

Statement B. If the cost price increases by Rs 500, and selling price remains the same, the profit percentage is decrease by 13%.

Statement C. If the marked price is kept at Rs 1000 above the cost price and a discount of 15% is given, then the profit percentage is decreased by .%.
options: Only A and B together
A and either B or C
Only A and C together
All statements are required
None of these

quiz.text:
What is the cost price of a table?

Statement I: By selling the table for Rs. 600 instead of Rs. 500, loss per cent decreases by 10%.

Statement II: When the cost price of the table increases by 10% and then decreases by 10%, it reduces by Rs. 10.

Statement III: By selling the table and a chair for Rs. 1500 a net profit of 25% is made.
options: Only A or B alone
Only B or C alone
Only A and C together
Any two of them together
Either B alone or A and C together are sufficient

quiz.text: A shopkeeper falsely weights an article 25% less than actual weight and sells it to customers. If he had used the correct weight the profit would have been 10%. What is the approximate effective profit percentage?
options: 47%
26%
35%
21%
42%

quiz.text: Ritu bought an article and marked a certain price on the article. She sold the article at a discount of 8% on the marked price such that selling price of the article is 15% more than the cost price of the article. If she marked the price of the article Rs.500 more than the cost price, profit earned by Ritu is what percent of the price marked by her?
options: 12%
20%
8%
None of these
8%

quiz.text: A sells an item to B at 30% profit. B sells it to C at 40% profit and C sells it to D at Rs 350 profit. The difference between the cost price of D and the cost price of A is Rs 1252. How much did B pay to A for the item?
options: Rs 2170
Rs 1260
Rs 1430
Rs 2107
2603

quiz.text: Raghav bought some chairs and tables from a shopkeeper of ratio 7:6. Marked price of a chair and a table is in the ratio 4:5 and shopkeeper gives discount of 10% and 20% on chairs and tables respectively. If total discount offered is Rs 2640,then find the total selling price of tables.
options: Rs. 7200
Rs. 360
Rs. 2640
Rs. 8700
None of these

quiz.text:
Tina bought two articles at same price. She sold one at a profit of 20% and other at a loss of 10%. From that amount she bought one refrigerator and marked its price _____% more than cost price and allowed a discount of 10% on the Marked price. If the cost price of each article was Rs.____, and the overall percent profit earned by Tina is 18.125%.Which of the following satisfies the two blanks given in the questions?

I. 20%, Rs.4000

II. 25%, Rs.4800

III. 25%, Rs.6000
options: Only I
Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only II and III

quiz.text: Prem goes to shopping and wants to purchase a laptop. The shopkeeper told him to pay 8% tax if he asked for the bill. Prem managed to get a discount of 2% on the SP in without tax of the laptop and paid to shopkeeper Rs.______. In doing so, he managed to avoid paying 8% tax. The amount of Rs. ______ discount that he has received on the selling price on inclusive of tax.
options: Rs.32900, Rs.4800
Rs.39700, Rs.4500
Rs.32700, Rs.4200
Rs.39200, Rs.4000
None of these

quiz.text: Rani decided to sell his house. Profit earned by Rani while selling the house at Rs ______ lakhs is equal to the loss incurred by Rani while selling the house at Rs.1.8lakh. Rani sells the same house at Rs. ______ lakhs and earned the profit of 40%.
options: 2, 2.5
2.2, 2.8
2.4, 3
Either b or c
None of these
